tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going every Saturday morning with wall-to-wall music videos, from classic hits and long-forgotten tracks from the rage vault, to the latest new releases and special features.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Jade Macmillan presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: Professor T
programme.desc: Professor T is asked to decipher a macabre puzzle when a doctor and her family are found dead in a grisly tableau on their living room sofa, each having died by different means...but in what order and at whose hands?

programme.title: Take 5 With Zan Rowe
programme.desc: Music runs in Jarvis Cockers veins. From manifesting his band Pulp as a teenager in Sheffield, to making a career as one of the defining acts of the Britpop era, his songs are his story.

programme.title: Back Roads
programme.desc: Lisa Millar ventures to one of Tasmanias oldest and most celebrated woodchopping carnivals, Henley-on-Mersey. Its here she learns how generations of axemen and women are keeping this iconic Aussie sport alive. (Final)

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: When an amateur psychics unsettling predictions for a grieving womans future start to come true, Humphrey must uncover the truth before its too late.

programme.title: rage Guest Programmer: Baker Boy
programme.desc: Celebrating the release of his brand-new album DJANDJAY, Baker Boy guest programs rage with his favourite music videos.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going with wall-to-wall music videos, from new releases to classics and the long-forgotten.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers joins Waleed Aly, Melissa Clarke and Paul Sakkal to discuss the week in parliament, Optus and the Triple Zero outage, Liberal Party turmoil, plus John Lyons and Matthew Doran with latest on the ceasefire in Gaza.

programme.title: The World This Week
programme.desc: Manny Tsigas presents a roundup of the weeks big stories: Israel and Hamas agree to phase one of a Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal after intense negotiations in Egypt, and Frances PM resigns after just 27 days in office.

programme.title: Songs Of Praise: Caring For Creation
programme.desc: To mark the season of Harvest, Aled Jones is in East Anglia to find out what the annual celebration means to local Christians and to talk about the importance of caring for creation.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Topiary Tips and Native Orchids
programme.desc: Costa discovers the art of topiary, Clarence explores a stunning collection of native orchids, Hannah dives into a pool converted to a frog pond, Millie plants root crops, and we visit a beautiful Italian-inspired homestead.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Semi-retired couple Garry and Fiona Learmonth are moving from Auckland to the small rural community of Loburn on the North Canterbury plains where they plan to build a home designed by Garry and modelled on a Stealth Bomber.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: E3 News and Ratchet and Clank: Rift Apart
programme.desc: We round up all the big family friendly announcements out of E3, plus we go on a spectacular dimension hopping adventure in Ratchet and Clank: Rift Apart!

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Nom Nom recruits the Bears to act as his entourage of friends. But when the Bears realise Nom Nom doesnt understand friendship, they decide to kick their day of bonding into high gear.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Because of a plan thought up by Marinette, Shadow Moth akumatizes two villains. Ladybug and Cat Noir will need help to stop the evil duo!

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: In this two part episode, Olive goes undercover in a high-stakes "Rock, Paper, Scissors" game.

programme.title: Hard Quiz Kids
programme.sub-title: Young Sheldon, Mr Olympia, Harry Styles and Cassowaries
programme.desc: To win Tom Gleesons Big Brass Mug, an eclectic collection of young experts are grilled on their knowledge of Young Sheldon, Mr Olympia, Harry Styles, and cassowaries!

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: After Jacob reveals a detail about his personal life, Janine realizes she doesnt know the other teachers as well as she thought.

programme.title: Pokemon: Diamond And Pearl
programme.desc: On their way to Eterna City, our heroes meet an unusual Nurse Joy who has a family: two little girls who want to be just like their mom!

programme.title: Officially Amazing Goes Bunkers
programme.desc: From towering dice and dangling acrobats to dizzying car stunts and ice skating leaps, this is a show packed full of daring and fun.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Ggsp Icymi: Pokemon Sword and Shield
programme.desc: We dive back into some of the best bits of GGSP! We review the latest mainline Pokemon adventure Sword and Shield, DARREN dives into the power of processors, and Gem shows you how to make your own Cuphead Cups!

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: What would happen if Shadow Moth created a fearsome supervillain while Marinette and Adrien couldnt transform into Ladybug and Cat Noir?

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: A two-part cliff-hanger where everything that Shaun knows and loves comes into question, when he impulsively makes a wish and must face up to some unexpected consequences.

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: The teachers are back at Willard R. Abbott Public School for development week.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Michael Pharoah, Xulio Merino, Topas and Toby Rudolph.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Addies fundraising campaign disrupts a beloved village event and Maggies attempts to get help end in disaster.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: The Universe Will Shatter! Destroyer Vs Super Saiyan God
programme.desc: The battle between gods continues to rage on, but their powers are starting to affect the universe. With each blow they exchange, the universe crumbles around them. Will the battle end before the universe does?!

programme.title: Slugterra Ascension
programme.desc: Trixie sets out to find the unruly little neo-protoform slugs who have wandered off into the woods. Meanwhile, Eli has been ceaselessly training with Burpy, wondering if his best friend will ever battle with him again.

programme.title: Ninjago Dragons Rising
programme.desc: Soras invention complicates Lloyd and Wildfires effort to free the dragons, while Sora escapes the lab in search of Riyu, whos missing.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The Titans avoid an alien hunter on the island.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Would a sinking ship exert a deadly pull on people in the water? Can a goldfishs memory last more than threee seconds? And, a musical myth with highly explosive results.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Michael has been playing truant, so Ben and Susan have to go back to school for parenting classes where they prove to be less than star pupils.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway?
programme.desc: Aisha Tyler hosts another episode of the legendary improv show featuring regulars Wayne Brady, Ryan Stiles and Colin Mochrie along with guest performer Brad Sherwood and star guest Cedric The Entertainer.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Inner truths are revealed at Addies first ever sleepover. But when Jenna asks awkward questions about Miss Murphy, Keedie clams up. In the 16th century a jail break is planned.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.desc: Goku continues to surprise Beerus with his growing powers. As their fight escalates, the universe manages to stay intact, but for how long? Then, Goku reverts back to a Super Saiyan! Have his godly powers run out?

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: When Ques ghostly face goes viral, Charlie is ready to cash in on her fame. But Pierce fears what all this exposure could lead to.

programme.title: Ninjago Dragons Rising
programme.desc: Lloyd and Wyldfyre lead the escaped dragons in a battle against the Claws while Sora and Arin search for Riyu in hopes of shutting down the Photacs.

programme.title: Gangnam Project
programme.desc: ASTRA are questioning if theyre on the right path, but when Ken reveals that a group member has decided to leave, everyone must work together to convince them to stay.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Breakstep Bridge / Row Skiing / Toothbrush Surprise
programme.desc: Can you destroy a bridge using just the rhythm of marching feet? Is there more in toothbrush bristles than meets the eye? And Jamie and Adam test the myth of human horsepower.

programme.title: Sharon and Ozzy Osbourne: Coming Home
programme.desc: This intimate documentary follows the final three years of Ozzys life as he and Sharon plan a return home after 25 years in LA, and prepare for the ultimate farewell gig.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Little Nana and Lambkin play with the great big tub. The tub rolls away with Little Nana inside. Hurry Lambkin! Catch the great big tub!

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: After searching high and low for something to do, Beep and Mort realise that, sometimes, having nothing to do can be a lot of fun.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Bop cant sleep because hes lost his favourite teddy bear, Spanna. Everyone decides to help find Spanna, so Bop can get a good nights sleep.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector has to calm an excitable Mole so that he can gather quiet sounds.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing wants Flop to read him his favourite book as he has his bath but Bing joins in with the story too enthusiastically Flop suggests they finish the story in bed as books dont like baths.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are playing in Grandpa Pigs garden. Peppa finds a little snail and Grandpa shows them his beehive. Peppa, George and their friends have fun pretending to be cheeky snails and busy bees.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its a beautiful day and Shaun, Bitzer and Timmy are enjoying a picnic, when an unexpected guest arrives and spoils the peace. Forced into hiding, the trio find ways to entertain themselves, until they have to brave up.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Its a space race as Supertato helps Carrot fly her baguette rocket to become the first Veggie on the cheese moon, but halfway there Evil Pea makes them crash land.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: When Isadoras friend, Nova the Glow Sprite visits Earth, she and Sashi have lots in common. Determined to join in, Isadora resorts to magic.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.sub-title: Meet The Super Monsters / Vampires Dont Dance
programme.desc: Drac struggles with a dance routine but learns its okay to make mistakes, while Zoe overcomes first-day preschool nerves thanks to her super-friendly classmates and teachers

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds spot a storm coming! They find out how to spot the signs, explore different types of storms, and watch as thunder, lightning, and rain become sunshine and a rainbow.

programme.title: The Gruffalo
programme.desc: Tells the magical tale of a mouse who takes a walk through the woods in search of a nut. Encountering predators, the plucky mouse has to use his wits to survive, creating an imaginary monster who turns out to be real.

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups go on a picnic adventure but dont know the food that is offered to them. Will they find another way to enjoy the unfamiliar food.

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.sub-title: I Like To Eat Apple And Bananas
programme.desc: Tsehay and John are in the Wiggly Kitchen doing some meal prep for a post work out meal and they find an apple and Banana, what could they make? Sing and dance along to the classic Apples and Bananas.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Ten puts the Numberblobs to sleep on a ten-frame bed, and sings a special song.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle takes the children to Grampy Rabbits gym class, where they learn how to be real explorers!

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Mrs. Hobbs offers a Salsa in the Park class, Millie struggles to learn the new dance.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley helps Hattie, Fred, and Fifi with a new food delivery service.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets attempt to train four young kids as Junior Junior Cadets - but their first lesson is a disaster!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas has a run of bad luck, he tries everything to get back on track... even if it means following Lorenzos strange, superstitious advice!

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Ben (aka Detective Deducer) finds a lost watch, he, Millie and Maya become detectives in order to return the watch to its rightful owner.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Clarence and the kids explore a tropical fruit farm and learn about how they grow, how to pick them and then feast on fruits theyve never tried before.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Some of Daddy Pigs important work papers have gone missing... because Mummy Pig, Peppa and George have accidentally made them into paper aeroplanes.

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: While setting up Tweaks latest tech to track creatures in the Congolese Jungle, Tracker, Kwazii, and Tweak stumble upon a young creature that appears to be missing from the Creature Collection.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Forced to wait five minutes in front of a restaurant for their takeaway order, Bluey and Bingo become restless for entertainment, pushing the very limits of Dads patience.

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar meet the tree kangaroo and learn how this kangaroo is great at climbing! They then take a look at the seahorses and its feeding time.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Mr Onion is riding on the Bumparoller when he discovers a great big hole in the road. What are we going to do? Mr Onion knows how to fix it!

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.sub-title: Beep And Mort Make A Movie
programme.desc: After seeing Beeps filming abilities, Mort and Pop are inspired to make a movie. Mort discovers that showbiz is tougher than he thought.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Zap decides he wants to walk on the moon and Bop builds him a set of wings, but they dont seem to work. Zaps friends decide if they cant get Zap to the moon they can bring the moon to Zap.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: When Mole is unsure of a coming storm, the Sound Collector comforts her with sound.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are visiting Daddy Pigs office. Daddy works with Mr Rabbit and Mrs Cat. Mr Rabbits job is all about numbers, Mrs Cats job is all about drawing shapes on the computer, and Daddy Pigs job is.. complicated.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Flock hear the enticing tunes of an ice cream van approaching and quickly hatch a plan to divert it into their field. While the driver seeks help, the Flock have great fun with an endless supply of ice cream.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: In the perilous plant aisle, Supertato and Evil Pea team up to find treasure as they have half a map each, but she tricks him and steals the map to find the treasure for herself.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Isadora wants to perform ballet at the Vampire Talent Show, but worries it unvampirey.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Katya learns that even helpful witches need help when her magic causes chaos at the library, while Frankies wand mishap brings carousel horses to life in a fun-filled adventure!

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds explore wetlands to find frogs! They discover tadpoles, see how frogs grow and change, and explore their powers like sticky tongues, big eyes, and colour-changing skin!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Sodor Sings Together
programme.desc: In preparation for the big Sodor Sings Festival - the biggest musical event on the - the engines are hard at work to make the night one to remember.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Four and Two attend a Shape Party in Flatland, meeting various 2D shapes along the way.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mrs Zebra teaches Peppa, George, Zoe, Zaza and Zuzu Zebra how to make a real tea set from clay.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie offers to babysit her little brother while Mom works on her laptop, Millie struggles to keep him occupied.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Everyone wants Stanleys help. Myrtle to make pancakes, Jose to unpack boxes, Peggy to tidy her tree house and Ari to do groovy moves for the dance class. Stanley invents three Can Bots to help.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets are planning an epic surprise pool party for Phillipas birthday but when things get out of hand, they forget the golden pool rule: keep the gate shut.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas helps his friend Ace overcome his fear of animals so that he can compete in the Super Stunt Rally.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Ben misses out seeing his favourite comic book artist and a miniature model of the Gauntlet of Doom, Millie and Maya recreate the gauntlet for him.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and the kids are inspired by a mural in a community garden by a local French artist, Hugues Sineux. They paint pots and add plants to complement the artwork and make the green space even more beautiful.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: The Biggest Muddy Puddle In The World
programme.desc: Peppa and George wake up one morning to find that all the rain has made a flood, and their house is now a desert island!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: Professor Natquik excitedly returns to his den for a relaxing vacation, but he arrives to find a red fox has moved in! Both refuse to budge until a snow storm locks them both in.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Playing Butterflies in the backyard is great fun, until Bluey runs away with Judo leaving Bingo all alone. Now poor Bingos heartbroken and Bluey needs to make amends.

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar watch a pride of lions in the safari park and the super-sized mountain chicken frog, which has a surprising connection to the lions.

programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Craig Smart in Perth.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: Swedish authorities suspect a Russian Orthodox church of being a spying hub for the Kremlin. Plus the artistic mosaics on Portugals streets are a trademark, but they have hidden dangers.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Kerry Stokes quits, amid planned merge with Southern Cross Media. Worried about misinformation? Youre the problem, according to tech overlords. Kidman and Urbans divorce hasnt stopped press from going into overdrive.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Nick Offerman tells the team about his new movie Sovereign, plus AFL star Travis Boak, Baker Boy and the South Australian designer behind Taylor Swifts look in her latest video, as well as movie news from Zak Hepburn.

programme.desc: Jade Macmillan presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Meredith Sheehan brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you todays events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.

programme.title: Not Stupid
programme.sub-title: Trump makes peace in the Middle East, but will he win the Nobel Prize?
programme.desc: Donald Trump has helped secure a peace deal in Gaza. Is the Nobel Peace Prize on the cards? Plus Jules and Jez talk about the first female Archbishop of Canterbury, Dame Sarah Mullally, who now leads 85 million Anglicans.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Hundreds of court cases including child abuse and sexual offences under review as police examine work by an officer in regional Victoria. Plus drought-stricken SA hit with a potato shortage leaving supermarket shelves bare.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong with the news from Asia: At least 19 children die after consuming toxic cough syrup in India, hundreds of trekkers rescued from a blizzard on the Tibetan side of Mt Everest, plus Japan set for its first woman PM.

programme.title: Aussie Mavericks
programme.desc: The outback and cattle station life can be hard and unforgiving. And for one woman it offered a life of adventure and opportunity. But dont even think about calling her just managers wife.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: We speak to Isabella Higgins about the rights and responsibilities of reporting from war zones, the importance of telling the stories of those affected, and how it helps hold governments and military powers to account.

programme.title: Not Stupid
programme.sub-title: Trump makes peace in the Middle East, but will he win the Nobel Prize?
programme.desc: Donald Trump has helped secure a peace deal in Gaza. Is the Nobel Peace Prize on the cards? Plus Jules and Jez talk about the first female Archbishop of Canterbury, Dame Sarah Mullally, who now leads 85 million Anglicans.

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan
programme.desc: The latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australias deaf community connected and informed. Presented by Miriam Corowa.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.sub-title: Dog Gone - The Hunt for Valerie
programme.desc: How the hunt for runaway sausage dog Valerie fired up the Kangaroo Island community and sparked headlines around the world.

programme.title: Back Roads
programme.desc: Lisa Millar ventures to one of Tasmanias oldest and most celebrated woodchopping carnivals, Henley-on-Mersey. Its here she learns how generations of axemen and women are keeping this iconic Aussie sport alive. (Final)

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Gold glitters for investors: how a flight to safety is smashing records for the precious metal. Plus paying off a mortgage into your 70s, the new normal for older borrowers in a hot property market. Presented by Alicia Barry.
